name: Focused Ultrasound (FUS) Therapy
summary: A noninvasive neuromodulation and lesioning technology using precisely targeted ultrasound energy to modulate or disrupt specific brain circuits. Investigated for treatment-resistant depression, OCD, essential tremor, and other neuropsychiatric disorders.
description: Focused Ultrasound (FUS) is an emerging neuromodulation modality that delivers acoustic energy through the skull to precise brain targets without open surgery. Depending on intensity and frequency, FUS can be used for noninvasive neuromodulation (low-intensity FUS, or LIFU) or permanent lesioning (high-intensity focused ultrasound, HIFU). MR-guided FUS allows real-time targeting and monitoring. Research applications in psychiatry include modulation of the anterior cingulate cortex, amygdala, and striatum to reduce symptoms of depression, OCD, and anxiety, as well as permanent lesioning of circuits implicated in severe treatment-resistant cases.

intervention_types: Low-intensity focused ultrasound (LIFU) for reversible neuromodulation
High-intensity focused ultrasound (HIFU) for permanent lesioning
delivery_methods: Transcranial ultrasound delivered with MRI guidance
metadata.regulatory_status: FDA-approved for essential tremor and tremor-dominant Parkinson’s disease; investigational for psychiatric disorders

off_label_uses: Exploratory in addiction, PTSD, and chronic pain
contraindications: Severe skull abnormalities preventing ultrasound transmission
Implanted metallic devices incompatible with MRI
clinical_metadata.safety_profile: Generally well tolerated. LIFU is considered reversible and safe in early-phase studies. HIFU can cause targeted lesions but carries risk of unintended tissue damage, edema, or neurological deficits.
clinical_metadata.evidence_level: Early-phase clinical trials and case series in psychiatric disorders; stronger evidence in essential tremor.
clinical_metadata.research_support: Ongoing NIH- and industry-supported trials for OCD and depression.

efficacy_rating.notes: Essential tremor rating refers to its neurological indication (FDA-approved).

sections.text: Focused Ultrasound uses acoustic energy to influence neural activity. Low-intensity (LIFU) alters neuronal membrane potentials and network dynamics, producing reversible neuromodulation without tissue destruction. High-intensity (HIFU), when combined with MRI targeting, creates precise ablations of dysfunctional brain circuits implicated in psychiatric or neurological disease.

sections.preparation: Patient screening, MRI planning, neurosurgical consultation. Shaved scalp for optimal acoustic transmission.
procedure: Patient positioned in MRI with FUS device coupled to scalp via water bath or transducer array
Real-time MR thermometry ensures precise targeting
Low- or high-intensity ultrasound delivered to chosen brain region
sections.frequency: Single session for lesioning; repeated sessions possible for LIFU
sections.total_treatment_time: One-time or short-term intervention depending on protocol

immediate: Reduced tremor in approved neurological uses
Transient changes in mood or anxiety (experimental)
short_term: Symptom reduction in depression or OCD in some trials
long_term: Potential durable circuit-level change; long-term efficacy in psychiatry still under investigation

special_considerations: Skull thickness and density can affect efficacy

studies: MRgFUS thalamotomy FDA-approved for essential tremor
Pilot studies show feasibility of anterior cingulate and amygdala LIFU neuromodulation in depression and anxiety
Case reports suggest OCD symptom reduction after targeted lesioning
sections.limitations: Small sample sizes, limited psychiatric efficacy data, technical challenges with skull penetration and targeting

sections.insurance_coverage: Approved coverage for essential tremor; not for psychiatric uses
sections.cost_effectiveness: Uncertain for psychiatric disorders pending further trials

concurrent_therapies: Psychotherapy and pharmacotherapy in psychiatric protocols

seo.title: Focused Ultrasound (FUS) Therapy for Depression, OCD, and Anxiety
seo.description: Focused ultrasound is a noninvasive, MR-guided neuromodulation technique under investigation for treatment-resistant depression, OCD, and anxiety. FDA-approved for essential tremor; psychiatric applications in early trials.
